arts.ttl: Alex Cochrane achieved personal target in Birmingham City’s draw with Crawley
arts.sum: Alex Cochrane reached a personal milestone in Birmingham City’s draw with Crawley by making his 50th appearance of the season – a target he set himself back in August. Opening up on his personal target for the season, Cochrane said: “It was to get 50 games and to hit 50 for this club is a real privilege for myself.

arts.ttl: 'I'll never shy away from that' Chris Davies outlines stance on Jay Stansfield incident
arts.sum: Blues’ players have been involved in a series of altercations this season and the latest came in the 0-0 draw with Crawley Town on Good Friday. Chris Davies won’t stop his Birmingham City players from backing each other – but he doesn’t want them to go too far.

arts.ttl: Champions Birmingham unable to find a way past Crawley
arts.sum: City were hoping to bounce back from their Wembley loss.

arts.ttl: Birmingham City player ratings as Stansfield and Willumsson misses result in Crawley draw
arts.sum: A sweeping passing move midway through the first half ended with Ethan Laird playing in Keshi Anderson and the winger fired a shot across goal that looked destined for the bottom corner until Steward got a strong right hand behind it. Klarer drove forward through the centre of the pitch and played one excellent pass into Paik to take Crawley’s midfielders out of the game in the second half.

arts.ttl: Chris Davies throws down the gauntlet to Birmingham City stars with futures at stake
arts.sum: Chris Davies is looking forward to watching his Birmingham City team play with freedom as League One champions, but rest assured that he isn’t willing to let them take their foot off the gas. On the face of it, Blues have six meaningless league games to conclude their season after winning the title last weekend.

arts.ttl: Chris Davies confirms Birmingham City’s next summer signing has been agreed
arts.sum: Chris Davies has confirmed that Alfons Sampsted will soon become a permanent Birmingham City signing. The Iceland international has spent this season on loan at Blues from FC Twente and a clause has been struck in the deal to force a permanent transfer on July 1.

arts.ttl: Birmingham City boss Chris Davies gives injury timelines for Krystian Bielik and Emil Hansson
arts.sum: Krystian Bielik ‘has a chance’ of playing again for Birmingham City this season and Emil Hansson is due to train next week according to boss Chris Davies. Birmingham City boss Chris Davies gives injury timelines for Krystian Bielik and Emil Hansson

arts.ttl: Birmingham City Women: A year of Amy Merricks but it all comes down to three matches
arts.sum: Blues have to defeat Durham at St Andrew’s @ Knighthead Park on Sunday and Newcastle United to ensure that their fate rests in their own hands come the final day on May 4, when they host London City in B9.
